body_html:
I am sorry that you are still running into issues.
However, I just verified on my test machine by building TF master on a machine cuda 8.0, cudnn 6.
tf.test.is_gpu_available() returns true, and I can run a very simple graph.

$ $ echo $LD_LIBRARY_PATH
/usr/local/cuda/lib64:/usr/local/cuda-8.0/lib64
$ ldd /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/tensorflow/python/_pywrap_tensorflow_internal.so
	linux-vdso.so.1 =>  (0x00007ffcc1ccd000)
	libtensorflow_framework.so => /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/tensorflow/python/../libtensorflow_framework.so (0x00007f612d0d5000)
	libcublas.so.8.0 => /usr/local/cuda/lib64/libcublas.so.8.0 (0x00007f612a725000)
	libcusolver.so.8.0 => /usr/local/cuda/lib64/libcusolver.so.8.0 (0x00007f61271b5000)
	libcudart.so.8.0 => /usr/local/cuda/lib64/libcudart.so.8.0 (0x00007f6126f4f000)
	libdl.so.2 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libdl.so.2 (0x00007f6126d4b000)
	libpthread.so.0 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libpthread.so.0 (0x00007f6126b2e000)
	libgomp.so.1 => /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libgomp.so.1 (0x00007f612690c000)
	librt.so.1 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/librt.so.1 (0x00007f6126704000)
	libm.so.6 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libm.so.6 (0x00007f61263fb000)
	libstdc++.so.6 => /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6 (0x00007f6126079000)
	libgcc_s.so.1 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libgcc_s.so.1 (0x00007f6125e63000)
	libc.so.6 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6 (0x00007f6125a99000)
	/lib64/ld-linux-x86-64.so.2 (0x00007f6137ab8000)
	libcuda.so.1 => /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libcuda.so.1 (0x00007f6124e0b000)
	libcudnn.so.6 => /usr/local/cuda/lib64/libcudnn.so.6 (0x00007f611b8a9000)
	libcufft.so.8.0 => /usr/local/cuda/lib64/libcufft.so.8.0 (0x00007f6112a5b000)
	libcurand.so.8.0 => /usr/local/cuda/lib64/libcurand.so.8.0 (0x00007f610eaf2000)
	libnvidia-fatbinaryloader.so.387.34 => /usr/lib/nvidia-387/libnvidia-fatbinaryloader.so.387.34 (0x00007f610e8a0000)
$ python 
Python 2.7.12 (default, Dec  4 2017, 14:50:18) 
[GCC 5.4.0 20160609] on linux2
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import tensorflow as tf
>>> tf.__version__
'1.6.0-rc1'
>>> tf.test.is_gpu_available()
....
True
>>> tf.Session().run(tf.constant('Hello World'))
...
2018-02-24 07:35:59.621155: I tensorflow/core/common_runtime/gpu/gpu_device.cc:1041] Created TensorFlow device (/job:localhost/replica:0/task:0/device:GPU:0 with 10747 MB memory) -> physical GPU (device: 0, name: Tesla K80, pci bus id: 0000:00:04.0, compute capability: 3.7)
'Hello World'

Please check your LD_LIBRARY_PATH actually points to your cuda and cudnn library directories, please make sure you follow CUDA installation instructions carefully to make sure you have correct version of cuda correctly installed.

As I have built the code from scratch and I was able to successfully run TF with cuda 8, I do not have a way to help you with this.
body_text:
I am sorry that you are still running into issues.
However, I just verified on my test machine by building TF master on a machine cuda 8.0, cudnn 6.
tf.test.is_gpu_available() returns true, and I can run a very simple graph.
$ $ echo $LD_LIBRARY_PATH
/usr/local/cuda/lib64:/usr/local/cuda-8.0/lib64
$ ldd /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/tensorflow/python/_pywrap_tensorflow_internal.so
	linux-vdso.so.1 =>  (0x00007ffcc1ccd000)
	libtensorflow_framework.so => /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/tensorflow/python/../libtensorflow_framework.so (0x00007f612d0d5000)
	libcublas.so.8.0 => /usr/local/cuda/lib64/libcublas.so.8.0 (0x00007f612a725000)
	libcusolver.so.8.0 => /usr/local/cuda/lib64/libcusolver.so.8.0 (0x00007f61271b5000)
	libcudart.so.8.0 => /usr/local/cuda/lib64/libcudart.so.8.0 (0x00007f6126f4f000)
	libdl.so.2 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libdl.so.2 (0x00007f6126d4b000)
	libpthread.so.0 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libpthread.so.0 (0x00007f6126b2e000)
	libgomp.so.1 => /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libgomp.so.1 (0x00007f612690c000)
	librt.so.1 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/librt.so.1 (0x00007f6126704000)
	libm.so.6 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libm.so.6 (0x00007f61263fb000)
	libstdc++.so.6 => /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6 (0x00007f6126079000)
	libgcc_s.so.1 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libgcc_s.so.1 (0x00007f6125e63000)
	libc.so.6 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6 (0x00007f6125a99000)
	/lib64/ld-linux-x86-64.so.2 (0x00007f6137ab8000)
	libcuda.so.1 => /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libcuda.so.1 (0x00007f6124e0b000)
	libcudnn.so.6 => /usr/local/cuda/lib64/libcudnn.so.6 (0x00007f611b8a9000)
	libcufft.so.8.0 => /usr/local/cuda/lib64/libcufft.so.8.0 (0x00007f6112a5b000)
	libcurand.so.8.0 => /usr/local/cuda/lib64/libcurand.so.8.0 (0x00007f610eaf2000)
	libnvidia-fatbinaryloader.so.387.34 => /usr/lib/nvidia-387/libnvidia-fatbinaryloader.so.387.34 (0x00007f610e8a0000)
$ python 
Python 2.7.12 (default, Dec  4 2017, 14:50:18) 
[GCC 5.4.0 20160609] on linux2
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import tensorflow as tf
>>> tf.__version__
'1.6.0-rc1'
>>> tf.test.is_gpu_available()
....
True
>>> tf.Session().run(tf.constant('Hello World'))
...
2018-02-24 07:35:59.621155: I tensorflow/core/common_runtime/gpu/gpu_device.cc:1041] Created TensorFlow device (/job:localhost/replica:0/task:0/device:GPU:0 with 10747 MB memory) -> physical GPU (device: 0, name: Tesla K80, pci bus id: 0000:00:04.0, compute capability: 3.7)
'Hello World'

Please check your LD_LIBRARY_PATH actually points to your cuda and cudnn library directories, please make sure you follow CUDA installation instructions carefully to make sure you have correct version of cuda correctly installed.
As I have built the code from scratch and I was able to successfully run TF with cuda 8, I do not have a way to help you with this.
body:
I am sorry that you are still running into issues.
However, I just verified on my test machine by building TF master on a machine cuda 8.0, cudnn 6.
tf.test.is_gpu_available() returns true, and I can run a very simple graph.

```
$ $ echo $LD_LIBRARY_PATH
/usr/local/cuda/lib64:/usr/local/cuda-8.0/lib64
$ ldd /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/tensorflow/python/_pywrap_tensorflow_internal.so
	linux-vdso.so.1 =>  (0x00007ffcc1ccd000)
	libtensorflow_framework.so => /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/tensorflow/python/../libtensorflow_framework.so (0x00007f612d0d5000)
	libcublas.so.8.0 => /usr/local/cuda/lib64/libcublas.so.8.0 (0x00007f612a725000)
	libcusolver.so.8.0 => /usr/local/cuda/lib64/libcusolver.so.8.0 (0x00007f61271b5000)
	libcudart.so.8.0 => /usr/local/cuda/lib64/libcudart.so.8.0 (0x00007f6126f4f000)
	libdl.so.2 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libdl.so.2 (0x00007f6126d4b000)
	libpthread.so.0 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libpthread.so.0 (0x00007f6126b2e000)
	libgomp.so.1 => /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libgomp.so.1 (0x00007f612690c000)
	librt.so.1 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/librt.so.1 (0x00007f6126704000)
	libm.so.6 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libm.so.6 (0x00007f61263fb000)
	libstdc++.so.6 => /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6 (0x00007f6126079000)
	libgcc_s.so.1 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libgcc_s.so.1 (0x00007f6125e63000)
	libc.so.6 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6 (0x00007f6125a99000)
	/lib64/ld-linux-x86-64.so.2 (0x00007f6137ab8000)
	libcuda.so.1 => /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libcuda.so.1 (0x00007f6124e0b000)
	libcudnn.so.6 => /usr/local/cuda/lib64/libcudnn.so.6 (0x00007f611b8a9000)
	libcufft.so.8.0 => /usr/local/cuda/lib64/libcufft.so.8.0 (0x00007f6112a5b000)
	libcurand.so.8.0 => /usr/local/cuda/lib64/libcurand.so.8.0 (0x00007f610eaf2000)
	libnvidia-fatbinaryloader.so.387.34 => /usr/lib/nvidia-387/libnvidia-fatbinaryloader.so.387.34 (0x00007f610e8a0000)
$ python 
Python 2.7.12 (default, Dec  4 2017, 14:50:18) 
[GCC 5.4.0 20160609] on linux2
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import tensorflow as tf
>>> tf.__version__
'1.6.0-rc1'
>>> tf.test.is_gpu_available()
....
True
>>> tf.Session().run(tf.constant('Hello World'))
...
2018-02-24 07:35:59.621155: I tensorflow/core/common_runtime/gpu/gpu_device.cc:1041] Created TensorFlow device (/job:localhost/replica:0/task:0/device:GPU:0 with 10747 MB memory) -> physical GPU (device: 0, name: Tesla K80, pci bus id: 0000:00:04.0, compute capability: 3.7)
'Hello World'
```

Please check your LD_LIBRARY_PATH actually points to your cuda and cudnn library directories, please make sure you follow CUDA installation instructions carefully to make sure you have correct version of cuda correctly installed.

As I have built the code from scratch and I was able to successfully run TF with cuda 8, I do not have a way to help you with this.
